Thorough knowledge of all the Athletic Policies approved by the Catawba County Schools Board of Education and is responsible for its implementation by the entire staff of the sports program.
Knowledge of existing school system, state, and conference regulations; implements them consistently and interprets them for staff.
Understand the proper administrative line of command and refer all requests of grievances through proper channels. Awareness of all public/staff/departmental meetings that require attendance.
Establish the fundamental philosophy, skills, and techniques to be taught by staff. Design conferences, clinics and staff meetings to insure staff awareness of overall program.
Train and inform staff, encourage professional growth by encouraging clinic attendance according to local clinic policy.
Delegate specific duty, supervise implementation, and at season's end, analyze staff effectiveness and evaluate all assistants.
Maintain discipline, adjust grievances, and work to increase morale and cooperation.
Assist the Athletic Director in scheduling, providing transportation, and requirements for tournament and special sport events.
Assist in the necessary preparation to hold scheduled sport events or practices and adhere to scheduled facility times. Coordinate program with maintenance and school employees.
Provide documentation to fulfill state and system requirements concerning physical examinations, parental consent, and eligibility.
Provide proper safeguards for maintenance and protection of assigned equipment sites. Advise the Athletic Director and recommend policy, method or procedural changes.
Provide training rules and any other unique regulations of the sport to each athlete who is considered a participant.
Give constant attention to a student athlete's grades and conduct.
Presence at all practices and games. Provide assistance, guidance, and safeguards for each participant.
Initiate programs and policies concerning injuries, medical attention, and emergencies.
Complete and submit proper paperwork on all disabling athletic injuries to athletic office within 24 hours.
Instill in each player a respect for equipment and school property, its care and proper use. Organize parents, coaches, players, and guests for pre-season meetings.
Promote the sport within the school through recruiting athletes who are not in another sports program. Promote the sport outside the school through news media, community recreation programs, or in any other feasible manner.
Responsible for the quality, effectiveness and validity of any oral or written release to local media.
Responsible for maintaining good public relations with news media, Booster Club, parents, officials, volunteers, and fans.
Present information to news media concerning schedules, tournaments, and results. Perform other duties as assigned by the school Principal in keeping with Catawba County Board of Education Policy and North Carolina Administrative Code and Statutes.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Must possess administrative and organizational skills in addition to a thorough knowledge of Catawba County Schools athletic policy and procedure as well as the North Carolina Administrative Code and Statutes. Ability to communicate effectively with students, staff, parents, and the community.
MINIMUM TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE
As applicable, must meet requirements established by the North Carolina High School Athletic Association, North Carolina Department of Public Instruction, the Catawba County Board of Education, and school administration. Teacher license and employment as a teacher by the Catawba County Board of Education is strongly preferred. Previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport.

Job.JobDescription:
The Volunteer Assistant Football Coach role at Chatham Central is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the Volunteer Assistant Football Coach is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at Chatham Central are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The Volunteer Assistant Football Coach listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the Volunteer Assistant Football Coach encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The Volunteer Assistant Football Coach follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At Chatham Central, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the Volunteer Assistant Football Coach at Chatham Central, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.

The Assistant Football Coach position at Chatham Central is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Assistant Football Coach is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Chatham Central, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Assistant Football Coach encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Assistant Football Coach also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Assistant Football Coach role at Chatham Central is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.

We are seeking a dynamic and dedicated individual to serve as our Track Coach for the upcoming season and beyond. The successful candidate will be responsible for leading, mentoring, and developing our student-athletes, while promoting a culture of sportsmanship, integrity, and excellence.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement a comprehensive track program that emphasizes skill development, strategy, and teamwork. Plan and conduct regular practice sessions, focusing on physical conditioning, skill drills, and competition preparation. Evaluate and select players for the team, ensuring a fair and inclusive tryout process. Collaborate with women's coach. Foster a positive and supportive team environment that promotes academic success, personal growth, and character development. Communicate effectively with athletes, parents, school administration, and the broader community.

The Varsity Boys Basketball Coach at Chatham Central is an integral member of the school's educational team, using athletics as a platform for teaching discipline, teamwork, and perseverance. This position calls for a coach who is organized, reflective, and committed to continuous improvement, both for themselves and for their athletes. The role blends hands‑on coaching with program administration and relationship‑building.
From a coaching standpoint, the Varsity Boys Basketball Coach is responsible for teaching the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport in a way that is accessible to student‑athletes. Practices are planned to include progressive skill work, position‑specific instruction, and opportunities for athletes to apply learning in controlled scrimmage situations. The coach pays attention to pacing and variety so that sessions remain engaging while still challenging students to stretch their comfort zones.
Culture is a central focus of this job. At Chatham Central, the Varsity Boys Basketball Coach helps create a team environment where respect, honesty, and effort are expected. The coach sets clear standards regarding communication, attendance, and sportsmanship, and works with athletes to understand why these standards matter. When expectations are not met, the coach responds fairly, explaining consequences and encouraging athletes to learn from mistakes.
The position also requires responsiveness to student needs. Coaches remain aware of the emotional and academic pressures students face and adjust support accordingly. Checking in with athletes, acknowledging their efforts, and partnering with school staff all contribute to a positive experience. The Varsity Boys Basketball Coach may assist in connecting students with resources when additional support is needed.
Outside of direct coaching, the role involves tasks such as coordinating with officials and opponents, assisting with scheduling, and managing team communication channels. The coach must be punctual, prepared, and detail‑oriented, ensuring that events run smoothly and that the team represents Chatham Central well at home and away.
Safety remains an ongoing responsibility. The Varsity Boys Basketball Coach follows district guidelines, maintains necessary certifications, and emphasizes proper warm‑up routines and technique to minimize risk of injury. This comprehensive approach to coaching allows student‑athletes to pursue their goals in a structured environment that prioritizes learning, well‑being, and long‑term success.

The Women Soccer Head Coach role at Seaforth is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the Women Soccer Head Coach is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. POSITION PURPOSE: The Assistant Athletic Director assists the School Athletic Director regarding the provision and supervision of athletic programs at the assigned school.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES Thorough knowledge of all the Athletic Policies approved by the Orange County Schools Board of Education Thorough knowledge of existing system, state, and conference regulations Thorough understanding of the proper administrative chain of command Thorough knowledge of the fundamental philosophy, skills, and techniques associated with the athletic program Thorough knowledge of state and federal requirements regarding physical examinations, parental consent, and eligibility for athletic participation Thorough knowledge of training rules and any other unique regulations about the various sports in which athletes are engaged Thorough knowledge of guidance and safeguards in place for the safety of athletes to address medical injuries and emergencies Thorough knowledge of the process for initiating policies and procedures applicable to the athletic program
EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND EXPERIENCE Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Physical Education or a related field Minimum of three (3) years of classroom experience as a Physical Education teacher at the middle or high school level Any equivalent combination of training and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities
CERTIFICATION AND LICENSE REQUIREMENTS NC Teacher Certification in Physical Education Must possess a valid driver's license issued by the NC Department of Motor Vehicles
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Master's Degree or additional credits beyond a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in a related field
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Responsible for the implementation by the entire staff of the sports program according to the OCS Athletic Policy and Board of Education policies 2. Implement existing system, state, and conference athletic regulations with fidelity 3. Utilize the proper administrative line of command and refer all requests and grievances through proper channels 4. Attend all required public/staff/departmental meetings 5. Establish the fundamental philosophy, skills, and techniques to be taught by staff 6. Design conferences, clinics, and staff meetings to ensure staff awareness of the overall program as needed 7. Encourage staff professional growth by encouraging clinic attendance according to local clinic policy 8. Delegate specific duties, supervise implementation, and at season's end, analyze staff effectiveness and help evaluate staff as needed 9. Maintain discipline, address grievances, and work to increase morale and cooperation 10. Assist the Athletic Director with scheduling, providing transportation, and communicating requirements for tournaments and special sporting events 11. Assist in the necessary preparation to hold scheduled sports events or practices, and adhere to scheduled facility times 12. Coordinate programs with maintenance and school employees 13. Provide documentation to fulfill state and system requirements concerning physical examinations, parental consent, and eligibility 14. Provide proper safeguards for maintenance and protection of assigned equipment and facilities 15. Advise the Athletic Director and recommend policy, method, or procedural changes 16. Assist in the preparation and administration of the athletic program budget 17. Assist in the responsibility for the collection, safeguarding, and disbursement of athletic event funds and ticket sales 18. Recommend the purchase of equipment, supplies, and uniforms as appropriate for the health, safety, and welfare of student athletes 19. Responsible for the maintenance of the athletic equipment inventory 20. Responsible for the development of the master sports schedule and coordinate/confirm dates, times, and locations of all contests with opposing schools 21. Secure officials for all home contests 22. Arrange transportation for all away contests 23. Schedule and secure all workers (i.e., clock operators, bookkeepers, ticket takers, etc.) for home contests 24. File all required reports with the conference or state in a timely manner 25. Verify each athlete's eligibility prior to the first contest for that sport 26. Distribute eligibility information to the head coach of each sport 27. Distribute eligibility information to system and school level personnel as required 28. Organize and schedule training for coaches as required by the state 29. Collect and maintain all required documentation relative to coaching certification and training 30. Assist in the coordination of the awards program for each sport 31. Plan and supervise a regular program of intramural/extramural/club sports activities for the students 32. Organize and schedule the use of all athletic facilities 33. Maintain an accurate and current inventory of all athletic equipment, supplies, and uniforms 34. Work with the Athletic Director, Principal, and coaches to develop and implement a plan for the maintenance and upkeep of all athletic facilities 35. Develop and maintain a positive public relations program 36. Work with the Athletic Director to promote athletic events and increase attendance 37. Coordinate with the Booster Club on fundraising activities 38. Assist in the recruitment, selection, and assignment of athletic department personnel 39. Ensure that all coaches are properly certified and meet all state and local requirements 40. Evaluate all coaches on a regular basis in accordance with system policy 41. Maintain good public relations with news media, Booster Club, parents, officials, volunteers, and spectators 42. Present information to the news media concerning schedules, tournaments, and results, if needed 43. Perform other duties as assigned by the Athletic Director, Athletic Supervisor, and/or School Principal

Work is considered moderate physical work requiring the exertion of up to 50 pounds of force. WORK ENVIRONMENT Employees in this position are required to work in indoor and outdoor environments and come into direct contact with OCS staff, students, and the public.

Job.JobDescription:
Position Overview
The Head Golf Coach at Vance County High School will be responsible for leading, developing, and managing the boys' and girls' golf program. The coach will foster an environment of sportsmanship, skill development, and academic success while promoting the values of teamwork, discipline, and leadership consistent with the mission of VCHS and the North Carolina High School Athletic Association (NCHSAA).
Key Responsibilities
Plan, organize, and supervise practices and competitions for the VCHS golf team. Teach fundamental golf skills, rules, and strategies to student-athletes of varying skill levels. Emphasize academic achievement, character development, and positive behavior both on and off the course. Ensure compliance with all VCHS, district, and NCHSAA policies, procedures, and eligibility requirements. Collaborate with the Athletic Director to schedule matches, secure transportation, and manage budgets. Communicate effectively with parents, athletes, staff, and community members. Promote safety and ensure proper supervision of student-athletes during practices, matches, and team travel. Maintain inventory and care of golf equipment, uniforms, and supplies. Serve as a positive role model for student-athletes, demonstrating integrity, respect, and professionalism at all times. Encourage student-athlete participation, recruitment, and retention for the program. Build relationships with local golf courses and community partners to enhance program opportunities.
Qualifications
Previous coaching experience (golf preferred) at the high school, collegiate, or competitive level. Strong knowledge of golf techniques, rules, and training strategies. Demonstrated ability to teach, mentor, and motivate student-athletes. Excellent communication and organizational skills. Commitment to academic success and student development. Must meet all Vance County Schools and NCHSAA coaching certification requirements, including CPR/First Aid training and background clearance.
Preferred Qualifications
Playing experience in competitive golf (high school, collegiate, or professional). Prior experience managing a golf program or working with youth athletics. Ability to build and sustain a program that develops both novice and advanced players.

The Middle School Cheerleading Coach position at Watauga High School is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the Middle School Cheerleading Coach works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The Middle School Cheerleading Coach at Watauga High School sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. Another important part of the job is collaboration. At Watauga High School, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The Middle School Cheerleading Coach encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The Middle School Cheerleading Coach is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.

The MS Baseball Head Coach position at Swain Middle School provides an opportunity to guide student‑athletes through an experience that combines challenge, support, and growth. This role is intended for coaches who see beyond wins and losses and who value the lasting impact that a positive athletic program can have on young people. Through careful planning, consistent expectations, and ongoing communication, the coach helps create a framework where athletes can thrive.
From an instructional perspective, the MS Baseball Head Coach prepares practices that sequence learning effectively. Early sessions may focus heavily on fundamentals and basic systems, while later practices refine execution and introduce more advanced concepts. The coach uses demonstrations, targeted drills, and guided scrimmages to help athletes apply what they learn. Regular assessment allows the coach to adjust plans based on the team’s progress.

At Swain Middle School, the MS Baseball Head Coach works to ensure that the environment is welcoming, fair, and focused on collective responsibility. The coach sets expectations around effort, communication, and respect, and follows through when those expectations are not met. Celebrating positive examples and giving athletes leadership opportunities strengthens the sense of ownership within the group.
Support for the broader student experience is built into the job. Coaches stay informed about academic calendars, test periods, and other school events so that practices and competitions are scheduled thoughtfully whenever possible. The MS Baseball Head Coach encourages athletes to communicate about conflicts in advance and to take initiative in managing their commitments. When students feel supported in both academics and athletics, they are more likely to remain engaged and successful.
Administrative responsibilities include coordination with the athletic department, assisting with transportation, submitting required paperwork, and maintaining accurate rosters. The coach must be attentive to detail and willing to complete these tasks reliably, as they directly affect the experience of athletes and families.
At its core, the MS Baseball Head Coach at Swain Middle School is a chance to teach, to mentor, and to build something that extends beyond a single season. Candidates who are motivated by the opportunity to help students grow through sport will find this position especially meaningful.

ACCOUNTABILITY OBJECTIVES: The Head Boys’ Tennis Coach is responsible for organizing and administering all levels of the Boys’ Tennis program at Bennington High School, ensuring compliance with NSAA rules and Bennington Public Schools policies.
POSITION CHARACTERISTICS:
REPORTS TO: Activities Director SUPERVISES: Assistant Coaches, Student Athletes EVALUATION: Annually by Activities Director CONTRACT: Annual, based on athletic season TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT: Salary and work year per Master Agreement
POSITION RELATIONSHIPS:
The Head Boys’ Tennis Coach works closely with the Activities Director, assistant coaches, student athletes, parents, and the school community to foster a positive and successful Boys’ Tennis program.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Program Development & Administration: Develop and implement a comprehensive Boys’ Tennis program for all levels (varsity, junior varsity, etc.). Organize and conduct tryouts, practices, and games/meets. Schedule non-conference games/meets in coordination with the Activities Director. Manage the Boys’ Tennis budget, including equipment inventory and purchasing. Ensure all athletes have completed necessary paperwork and are eligible to participate. Coordinate transportation and other logistics for away contests. Maintain accurate records of team statistics, participation, and awards.
Coaching & Player Development: Provide instruction in the fundamentals, techniques, and strategies of tennis. Develop and implement practice plans that are organized, efficient, and promote skill development. Foster a positive and competitive team environment that encourages sportsmanship, teamwork, and respect. Monitor the academic progress of student athletes and provide support as needed. Implement and enforce team rules and school athletic policies.
Communication & Public Relations: Communicate effectively with players, parents, assistant coaches, and the Activities Director. Promote the Boys’ Tennis program within the school and community. Work cooperatively with local media.
Compliance: Adhere to all rules and regulations of the Nebraska School Activities Association (NSAA). Comply with all Bennington Public Schools policies and procedures. Attend required meetings and professional development.
Other Duties: Perform other duties as assigned by the Activities Director.
Essential Functions: 1. the ability to perform the identified tasks and to possess and utilize the identified knowledge, skills, and abilities and to perform the identified work environment characteristics. 2. the ability to perform the identified physical requirements as outlined in working environment.
Working Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to lift and pull or push articles up to 50 pounds. He/she sits most of the time but must walk frequently and, at times, stand. The employee is required to reach with his/her hands and continuously to repeat the same hand, arm, or finger motion many times as in typing. Manual and finger dexterity are essential to the job. He/she is constantly working to meet deadlines with severe time restraints. He/she must see and read fine print such as typed or handwritten materials and have good depth perception (fine muscle control). The employee must, also, be able to hear conversation in a noisy environment and to communicate clearly and concisely through speech.
---
The information contained in this job description is for compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and is not an exhaustive list of the duties performed for this position. Additional duties are performed by the individuals currently holding this position and additional duties may be assigned.

The Varsity Softball Assistant Coach position at Regional School Unit 6 is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Varsity Softball Assistant Coach is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Regional School Unit 6, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Varsity Softball Assistant Coach encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Varsity Softball Assistant Coach also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Varsity Softball Assistant Coach role at Regional School Unit 6 is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.

The 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach position at North Farmington High School is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach at North Farmington High School sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At North Farmington High School, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the 25-ATH-28 Girls JV Head Tennis Coach position at North Farmington High School is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.

The Assistant Baseball Coach at North Point High School is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Assistant Baseball Coach plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at North Point High School reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Assistant Baseball Coach expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Assistant Baseball Coach supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Assistant Baseball Coach may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at North Point High School. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.

Job.JobTitle: Middle School Assistant Girls Track Coach
Job.JobDescription:
The Middle School Assistant Girls Track Coach position at Jamestown Middle School is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the Middle School Assistant Girls Track Coach works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The Middle School Assistant Girls Track Coach at Jamestown Middle School sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At Jamestown Middle School, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The Middle School Assistant Girls Track Coach encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The Middle School Assistant Girls Track Coach is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the Middle School Assistant Girls Track Coach position at Jamestown Middle School is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.

The Girls JV Basketball Coach role at Concord High School emphasizes collaboration, consistency, and long‑term program development. This position is ideal for a coach who enjoys working as part of a broader athletic staff and who values building connections across grade levels and teams. The goal is to help create a smooth pathway for student‑athletes as they progress, while maintaining a recognizable identity and standard of excellence for the program.
In practical terms, the Girls JV Basketball Coach coordinates closely with the athletic director and fellow coaches to align terminology, teaching priorities, and expectations. This might involve participating in coaching meetings, sharing practice plans, and adapting approaches so that athletes experience similar structures and messages at each level. At Concord High School, the program is strongest when coaches communicate and support one another.

The coach works to balance repetition with variety, ensuring that key fundamentals are constantly reinforced while athletes also experience new challenges. A welcoming, organized presence can greatly influence how the program is perceived.

The Girls JV Basketball Coach monitors team morale, assists students in managing the demands of school and sport, and reinforces the importance of rest, nutrition, and healthy habits. The coach keeps the focus on sustainable growth rather than shortcuts, emphasizing that consistent effort over time leads to meaningful improvement.
Administrative tasks such as roster management, schedule communication, and equipment oversight are also part of the position. The Girls JV Basketball Coach must handle these responsibilities reliably, as they are essential to maintaining a well‑run program. Coaches who enjoy seeing the big picture, who are willing to share ideas, and who care about the experience of every athlete will thrive in this role at Concord High School.

Demonstrates thorough knowledge of all athletic policies approved by RSU 57 and ensures their consistent implementation. 2. Secures facilities upon departure and promotes respect for school property among student-athletes. Public Relations 1. Organizes and leads preseason meetings for parents and student-athletes. 2. Promotes the swim program within the school and community to encourage participation. 3. Ensures accuracy and professionalism in communications with local media. 4. Maintains positive relationships with parents, officials, volunteers, booster organizations, and the community. 5. Shares schedules, results, and program highlights with appropriate audiences. The goal is to help create a smooth pathway for student‑athletes as they progress, while maintaining a recognizable identity and standard of excellence for the program.
In practical terms, the Assistant Track Coach coordinates closely with the athletic director and fellow coaches to align terminology, teaching priorities, and expectations. This might involve participating in coaching meetings, sharing practice plans, and adapting approaches so that athletes experience similar structures and messages at each level. At AC Reynolds Middle School, the program is strongest when coaches communicate and support one another.
Day‑to‑day responsibilities include designing practices that teach core skills, reinforcing team concepts, and preparing athletes for competition. The coach works to balance repetition with variety, ensuring that key fundamentals are constantly reinforced while athletes also experience new challenges. The Assistant Track Coach reviews performance with the team, helping athletes learn how to analyze both successes and mistakes in a constructive way.
The role extends into community and family engagement. Coaches represent AC Reynolds Middle School at games, parent meetings, and potential youth outreach events. The Assistant Track Coach may help host clinics or camps, encourage younger students to try the sport, and provide information about expectations to families who are new to the program. A welcoming, organized presence can greatly influence how the program is perceived.
Athlete support is ongoing. The Assistant Track Coach monitors team morale, assists students in managing the demands of school and sport, and reinforces the importance of rest, nutrition, and healthy habits. The coach keeps the focus on sustainable growth rather than shortcuts, emphasizing that consistent effort over time leads to meaningful improvement.
Administrative tasks such as roster management, schedule communication, and equipment oversight are also part of the position. The Assistant Track Coach must handle these responsibilities reliably, as they are essential to maintaining a well‑run program. Coaches who enjoy seeing the big picture, who are willing to share ideas, and who care about the experience of every athlete will thrive in this role at AC Reynolds Middle School.

Job.JobDescription:
ATHLETIC COACH (to include Cheerleading)
Under general supervision, assist the board in the fair and just discharge of its obligation to students and staff through performance of the Head Coach role over and beyond the duties of a classroom teacher. Reports to the school principal and athletic director.
SPECIFIC DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Thorough knowledge of all the Athletic Policies approved by the Catawba County Schools Board of Education and is responsible for its implementation by the entire staff of the sports program.
Knowledge of existing school system, state, and conference regulations; implements them consistently and interprets them for staff.
Understand the proper administrative line of command and refer all requests of grievances through proper channels. Awareness of all public/staff/departmental meetings that require attendance.
Establish the fundamental philosophy, skills, and techniques to be taught by staff. Design conferences, clinics and staff meetings to insure staff awareness of overall program.
Train and inform staff, encourage professional growth by encouraging clinic attendance according to local clinic policy.
Delegate specific duty, supervise implementation, and at season’s end, analyze staff effectiveness and evaluate all assistants.
Give constant attention to a student athlete’s grades and conduct.
Presence at all practices and games. Provide assistance, guidance, and safeguards for each participant.
Initiate programs and policies concerning injuries, medical attention, and emergencies.
Complete and submit proper paperwork on all disabling athletic injuries to athletic office within 24 hours.
Direct student managers, assistants, and statisticians.
Determine discipline, delineate procedures concerning due process when the enforcement of discipline is necessary and contact parents when a student is dropped or becomes ineligible.
Assist athletes in their college or advanced educational selection.
Participate in the budgeting function with the Athletic Director by establishing requirements for the next season. Recommend guidelines as to type, style, color, or technical specifications of equipment. Responsible for operating within budget appropriations.
Accountable for all equipment and/or collection of fees for any lost or unreturned equipment. Arrange for issuing, storing, and reconditioning of equipment and submit annual inventory and current records.
Properly mark and identify all equipment before issuing or storing.
Monitor equipment rooms and coaches’ offices, authorize who may enter, issue or requisition equipment.
Permit the athletes to only be in authorized areas of the building at the appropriate times.
Examine locker rooms before and after practices and games, checking on general cleanliness of the facility. Be responsible for cleanliness and maintenance of specific sport equipment.
Secure all doors, lights, windows, and locks before leaving building if custodians are not on duty.
Instill in each player a respect for equipment and school property, its care and proper use. Organize parents, coaches, players, and guests for pre-season meetings.
Promote the sport within the school through recruiting athletes who are not in another sports program. Promote the sport outside the school through news media, community recreation programs, or in any other feasible manner.
Responsible for the quality, effectiveness and validity of any oral or written release to local media.
Responsible for maintaining good public relations with news media, Booster Club, parents, officials, volunteers, and fans.
Present information to news media concerning schedules, tournaments, and results. Perform other duties as assigned by the school Principal in keeping with Catawba County Board of Education Policy and North Carolina Administrative Code and Statutes.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Must possess administrative and organizational skills in addition to a thorough knowledge of Catawba County Schools athletic policy and procedure as well as the North Carolina Administrative Code and Statutes. Ability to communicate effectively with students, staff, parents, and the community.
MINIMUM TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE
As applicable, must meet requirements established by the North Carolina High School Athletic Association, North Carolina Department of Public Instruction, the Catawba County Board of Education, and school administration. Teacher license and employment as a teacher by the Catawba County Board of Education is strongly preferred. Previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport.
DISCLAIMER
The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees to this job.

POSITION PURPOSE: The Assistant Coach is responsible for providing appropriate coaching guidance to student-athletes related to a particular sport for the duration of the sports season. As part of the Athletic Program at the assigned school, the Assistant Coach is responsible for teaching and modeling good sportsmanship behaviors, appropriate techniques, and skills related to the particular sport, ensuring safe practices are implemented to protect the students from physical injuries, and serving as good role models for the students, the school, and the school system.
KNOWLEDGE OF POSITION: Thorough knowledge of the fundamental philosophy, skills, and techniques associated with the athletic program Thorough knowledge of state and federal requirements regarding physical examinations, parental consent, and eligibility for athletic participation Thorough knowledge of training rules and any other unique regulations about the various sports in which athletes are engaged Thorough knowledge of guidance and safeguards in place for the safety of athletes to address medical injuries and emergencies Thorough knowledge of the process for initiating policies and procedures applicable to the athletic program
EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND EXPERIENCE High School Diploma or GED
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (These are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work performed. The omission of specific duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment to the position.) 1. Has a thorough knowledge of all the athletic policies approved by the Orange County Schools Board of Education and is responsible for their implementation 2. Has knowledge of the existing system-wide and conference regulations; implements them consistently 3. Understands the proper administrative line of command and refers all requests or grievances through proper channels. Is aware of all public/staff/departmental meetings that require attendance 4. Maintains discipline, addresses grievances, and works to increase morale and cooperation 5. Assists in the necessary preparation to hold scheduled sport events or practices and adheres to scheduled facility times. Coordinates program with maintenance and school employees 6. Assists in providing documentation to fulfill state and system requirements concerning physical examinations, parental consent, and eligibility 7. Provides assistance, guidance, and safeguards for each participant 8. Completes and submits proper documentation to the Athletic Director for out-of-season clinics, camps, workouts, etc. 9. Recommends to the Head Coach the purchase of equipment, supplies, and uniforms as appropriate 10. Maintains necessary attendance forms, insurance records, and similar paperwork 11. Oversees the safety conditions of the facility or area in which assigned sport is conducted at all times that students are present 12. Enforces discipline and sportsmanlike behavior at all times, and establishes and oversees penalties for breach of such standards by individual students 13. Supervises practices, games and team trips 14. Takes an active role in the prevention of drug, alcohol, and tobacco abuse 15. Assist with the collection of the cost of any equipment lost or not returned 16. Assist with issuing and storing equipment and submit an annual inventory and current records to the Head Coach 17. Recommend program area budgetary items for subsequent years to the Head Coach 18. Assist with monitoring and authorizing entrance to equipment rooms and coaches’ offices 19. Assist with examining locker rooms for general cleanliness before and after practices and games 20. Share responsibilities for upkeep and regular care of facilities and fields 21. Assist with ensuring the cleanliness and maintenance of specific sports equipment 22. Assist in securing all doors, lights, windows, and locks before leaving the building if custodians are not on duty 23. Assist with instilling in each player respect for each other, athletic equipment, and school property, including its care and proper use 24. Assist the Head Coach in carrying out their responsibilities 25. Assist with instructing the team members regarding changes in the rules and teaching fundamentals of the sport as outlined by the Head Coach 26. Assist with maintaining a record of team statistics and requirements for lettering (for Head Coach) 27. Work within the basic framework and philosophy of the Head Coach of that sport 28. Attend all staff meetings and carry out scouting assignments as outlined by the Head Coach 29. Arrive early enough before practice, contests, and meetings to assist with preparation adequately and remain long enough afterward to help players with problems and/or be involved in staff discussions 30. Assist with the planning and implementation of both in-season and out-of-season conditioning and weight programs 31. Strive to improve skills by attending clinics and using resources made available by the Head Coach 32. Attend most of the contests, when possible, of other teams in the program 33. Perform other duties as assigned by the Head Coach or Athletic Director
DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general purpose and responsibilities assigned to this position. They are not intended to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and skills that may be required of the employees assigned to this position. This description may be revised by the supervisor, with HR review and approval, at any time.
WORKING CONDITIONS PHYSICAL DEMANDS Depending on the sport, work may be considered light to heavy, requiring the exertion of up to 100 pounds of force. Position may require a lot of standing, walking, kneeling, squatting, pushing, pulling, and running.
WORK ENVIRONMENT Employees in this position are required to work in indoor and outdoor environments, with possible exposure to excessive heat and cold, and come into direct contact with OCS staff, students, and the public.

The Assistant Baseball Coach role at Jackson County Public Schools is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the Assistant Baseball Coach is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At Jackson County Public Schools, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The Assistant Baseball Coach sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At Jackson County Public Schools, the Assistant Baseball Coach is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the Assistant Baseball Coach at Jackson County Public Schools is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

The Men's Tennis Coach - PCHS at Polk County is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Men's Tennis Coach - PCHS plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Polk County reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Men's Tennis Coach - PCHS expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Men's Tennis Coach - PCHS supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Men's Tennis Coach - PCHS may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Polk County. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.
